Key Match Events: Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller's record 79-run fifth-wicket stand
Kagiso Rabada bowled the 18th over, despite not being his best at the tournament so far
Mahmudullah missed a flick off Ottneil Baartman, which hit his front pad and deflected to the boundary for what looked like four leg byes
Maharaj was tasked with the final over after Markram bowled the seamers out earlier
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa leave the USA with three wins from three matches, and will move to St. Vincent to play Nepal in their last group match
Bangladesh also head to the West Indies, and will play Netherlands and Nepal, with the Super 8s still in sight
Hendricks, whose scores of 4, 3 and 0 are the lowest of the trio, and whose methods of dismissal appear to show a technical deficiency
Miller was given a gift when he edged the first ball Mahmudullah bowled, but Litton Das was unable to react quickly enough to take the catch
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa maintained a 100% win-record at the T20 World Cup 2024
Bangladesh's inability to capitalise on Keshav Maharaj bowling the final over for the first time in T20Is and sending down three full tosses, cost them the game
The biggest concern will be Hendricks, whose scores of 4, 3 and 0 are the lowest of the trio, and whose methods of dismissal appear to show a technical deficiency
Others: South Africa's top three have underperformed thus far, albeit on tough batting surfaces
Only Uganda and PNG average lower than South Africa's top three
Klaasen and Miller showed maturity against spinners
The test was when Maharaj, who has never done this job before, was left with the final six balls
